channel.title: Declaring a boolean method in actionhandler
channel.description: I want an npc to execute my public boolean joinBH What would be the line for that? i tried alot. Thanks!

item.title: Declaring a boolean method in actionhandler
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

What “ActionHandler” are you referring to? The JCL or a custom one created by the server?
If you want it to call a method of another class from the action handler, you need a global, final, or static reference to the object. (Assuming you are creating an anonymous instance of the class, EX: new ActionHandler(…){…};

If you were to tell me to punch your friend in the face, and you defined a friend as someone of some meaningful connection to you. I would punch you in the face. This action accurately reflected your request.

If you want any answer of meaning, assume we know nothing (like a computer). You have to give us the details, or at least the means of acquiring them.

Read full topic
item.source: Declaring a boolean method in actionhandler

item.title: Declaring a boolean method in actionhandler
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

If the method is static

ActionHandler.joinBH(parameters here if any);

if not static… And the object isn’t already linked to it…

ActionHandler a = new ActionHandler();
a.joinBH(parameters here if any);

Don’t forget imports.

When I say “linked to it”, see:

private ActionHandler actionHandler = new ActionHandler(this); /// lines later.... public ActionHandler getActions() { return actionHandler; }
in the client class in your server.

Read full topic
